config.question: Which of the following partly explains why the delegates at the Second Continental Congress appointed George Washington the commander of the newly formed Continental Army?

choices.content: his ties to the French embassy

answer_3.response: The delegates formed a Continental Army and appointed George Washington its commander, in part because he seemed to have more military experience than anyone else available and in part because he looked like he should be commander in chief.
